1985 VB|1}} || November 1, 1985 |- | [[79086 Gorgasali]] || September 4, 1977 |} '''Richard Martin West''' (born 1941) is a [[Denmark|Danish]] [[astronomer]] who worked at the [[European Southern Observatory]] (ESO). He discovered numerous [[comet]]s, including [[Comet West]] (C/1975 V1), which was one of the brightest comets of the 1970s,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=oaqp7byW99YC&pg=PA151&lpg=PA151&dq=brightest+comet+1970s&source=bl&ots=VpYj9wBHmL&sig=tcELcytCVQLDG-7LyJF9XKjLiCY&hl=en&sa=X&ei=3M8IT46qGart0gG92tG2Ag&ved=0CGIQ6AEwC |title=New Scientist - Google Books |publisher=Books.google.com |date= |accessdate=2012-01-08}}</ref> and the periodic comets [[76P/West-Kohoutek-Ikemura]] and [[123P/West-Hartley]]. He also discovered a number of [[asteroid]]s, including the [[Trojan asteroid]]s [[2146 Stentor]], [[2148 Epeios]] and [[(20995) 1985 VY]]. He co-discovered (with [[Hans-Emil Schuster]]) the [[Phoenix Dwarf]] galaxy. <!--- Asteroid 2022 West possibly named in his honour. Although discovered in 1938, it may have been named much later. Between 1938 and Richard M.'s first appearance (1967), nine other Wests to show up in the ADS are: D. C. (1 hit, 1942); Thomas S. (1 hit, 1957); Frederick, Jr. (1 hit, 1964); R. (1964 and 1976, probably different people); L. A. (1 hit, 1964); Donald Keith (1965, 1972, 1975...); Harry I., Jr. (1966, 1972, 1974, 1975...); Frederick Richard (1966 onward). Reinmuth died in 1979. Note that the asteroids around 2022 in numerical sequence (e.g. 1999 Hirayama) were mostly discovered in 1973, so a late naming is plausible. ---> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.eso.org/~rwest/ Richard West's homepage] {{Authority control|VIAF=88051826}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = West, Richard Martin | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Danish astronomer | DATE OF BIRTH = 1941 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:West, Richard Martin}} [[Category:1941 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:20th-century astronomers]] [[Category:Danish astronomers]] [[Category:Discoverers of asteroids]] [[Category:Discoverers of comets]] {{Europe-astronomer-stub}} {{Denmark-scientist-stub}}
